achievements: First African-American actress to be nominated for an Academy Award for Best Actress
Starred in films such as Carmen Jones and Porgy and Bess

occupation: Poet, short story writer, critic, and satirist
achievements: Known for her sharp wit and satirical writing style
Member of the Algonquin Round Table
Wrote poetry collections such as Enough Rope and Collected Poems
Won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1964 for her work on determining the structures of important biochemical substances using X-ray crystallography.
Determined the structures of penicillin, vitamin B12, and insulin.
Co-founded the Catholic Worker Movement, a movement dedicated to social justice and serving the poor.
Known for her pacifist beliefs and opposition to war.
